sentence: Home improvement warehouse operators The Home Depot, Inc. ( HD ) and Lowe's Companies, Inc. ( LOW ) on Monday both caught big upgrades from analysts at Piper Jaffray.
The firm said it upgraded HD from "Neutral" to "Overweight" while lifting its price target from $47 to $62.
That new target suggests a 22% upside to the stock's Friday closing price of $50.96.
Meanwhile, Piper Jaffray also boosted its rating on LOW from "Neutral" to "Overweight" and raised its price target from $29 to $41.
That target implies a healthy 29% upside to the stock's Friday closing price of $31.69.
Home Depot and Lowe's shares both gained around 1.2% in premarket trading Monday.
Shares of Home Depot ( HD ) have a 2.28% dividend yield, based on Friday's closing stock price of $50.96.
The stock has technical support in the $45-$47 price area.
If the shares can firm up, we see overhead resistance around the $53-$56 price levels.
Shares of Lowe's ( LOW ) have a 1.77% dividend yield, based on Friday's closing stock price of $31.69.
The stock has technical support in the $27-$28 price area.
If the stock can firm up, we see overhead resistance around the all-time high levels of $34-$35 a share.
The Home Depot, Inc. ( HD ) and Lowe's Companies, Inc. ( LOW ) are both currently rated "Neutral" by Dividend.com.
